intro: Amanoa collina, commonly known as the Hawaiian mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Amanoa collina typically grows in moist, shaded areas at high elevations. It plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of Hawaii.
